events.title: International law meant to limit effects of war at breaking point, study finds
events.description: Report covering 23 conflicts over last 18 months concludes more than 100,000 civilians have been killed as war crimes rage out of control An authoritative survey of 23 armed conflicts over the last 18 months has concluded that international law seeking to limit the effects of war is at breaking point, with more than 100,000 civilians killed, while torture and rape are committed with near impunity. The extensive study by the Geneva Academy of International Humanitarian Law and Human Rights describes the deaths of 18,592 children in Gaza, growing civilian casualties in Ukraine and an â€œepidemicâ€ of sexual violence in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Rubaya produces about 15% of the worldâ€™s coltan, which is processed into tantalum â€“ a heat-resistant metal that is in high demand by makers of mobile phones, computers, aerospace components and gas turbines. The site, where local people dig manually for a few dollars a day, has been under the control of the M23 rebel group since 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: The political fallout of the Epstein files
events.description: After more than three million documents related to Jeffrey Epstein were released last Friday, tensions are growing across the globe. The disclosures have raised fresh questions about the convicted sex offender's relationships with the rich and powerful. Britain's former prince Andrew, his ex-wife Sarah Ferguson and career politician, Peter Mandelson, are among those who've been thrust back into the eye of the Jeffrey Epstein storm, after shocking, often intimate emails with the disgraced financier were released by the US Justice Department. Donald Trump, Elon Musk and Bill Gates were also mentioned in the tranche of three million documents. Sharon Gaffney spoke with Ian Reifowitz, distinguished professor at the State University of New York, about the latest on the fallout, and the reaction to the disclosures in the US.

Instead, they encountered something closer to a living hell. They were denied basic human rights and forced to endure extreme hardship. events.title: What Jared Kushner's 'New Gaza' plan includes, and what it leaves out
events.description: President Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner laid out a plan for a "New Gaza." A close look suggests it makes room for fewer Palestinians and less housing.

events.title: France's 2026 budget finally gets passed
events.description: Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu's minority government made it through two no-confidence votes before finally getting his 2026 budget over the line.

events.title: Russian captain found guilty in North Sea tanker collision
events.description: Vladimir Motin has been convicted for manslaughter after a deadly collision last year off the coast of the UK.

events.title: Trump announces India 'trade deal' after Modi call
events.description: After speaking with India's PM, Trump said that the US would lower its tariff rate on Indian goods, while again claiming that India had agreed to stop buying Russian oil. Modi thanked Trump for the deal.

events.title: Syrian army enters Kurdish-held al-Hassakeh after deal
events.description: An agreement to transition control from Kurdish to government forces is now underway. It brings the end to weeks of fighting as well as the Kurds' years-long de facto autonomy.

events.title: How a heckled Canadian became Germany's Olympic hockey coach
events.description: Harold Kreis is set to head to his first Olympic Games as coach of the German men's ice hockey team. Now a legend of the game in his adopted homeland, he wasn't welcomed by all when he first arrived from Canada.

events.title: France adopts delayed 2026 budget ending months of parliamentary deadlock
events.description: French prime minister SÃ©bastien Lecornu has survived the last of a series of no-confidence votes, allowing the full 2026 budget to be adopted. The centurist prime minister had pushed the bill through parliament without a vote after securing the backing of the Socialist Party in exchange for some costly concessions. Also in the segment, US President Donald Trump says he will lower tariffs on Indian goods after New Delhi committed to ending its purchases of Russian oil.

events.title: Epstein files: AI photos circulate of Zohran Mamdaniâ€™s mother at party
events.description: The fallout continues after the US Department of Justice released over 3 million documents pertaining to disgraced sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. New York mayor Zohran Mamdani's mother, film director Mira Nair was named in an email, in reference of attending a film party. But AI-generated images by a parody account triggered viral false claims Mamdani has devious political connections or is Epstein's illegitimate son. Vedika Bahl debunks them in Truth or Fake.

events.title: France balances tax relief and new charges in 2026 budget
events.description: France is set to adopt its 2026 budget on Monday, pending Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu surviving a no-confidence vote. The budget freezes income tax for many, keeps domestic help credits, and offers â‚¬1 student meals, but introduces a â‚¬2 import tax and a large company profit tax. Passed via 49.3, it aims to cut the deficit to 5% of GDP.

events.title: France gears up for Milano-Cortina 2026 bobsleigh Olympic races
events.description: As the Milano-Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics approach, Franceâ€™s bobsleigh teams train at La Plagne. Romain Heinrich pilots the two- and four-man teams, while Margot Boch leads the womenâ€™s events. France aims for a top-10 finish amid strong German and American competition, with eyes already on 2030.

events.title: Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt has reopened in both directions for Palestinians
events.description: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt has reopened to a limited amount of foot traffic, an Israeli security official said Monday. An Egyptian official said that 50 Palestinians would cross in each direction on the first day of the crossing's reopening.

events.title: Son of Norway's crown princess arrested ahead of trial on rape and other charges
events.description: The eldest son of Norway's crown princess has been arrested over new criminal allegations ahead of a trial on charges including rape.

events.title: Trump to close Kennedy Center for two years - sparking more controversy over DC venue
events.description: Donald Trump has said the Kennedy Center will close for two years in plans that are fuelling the growing controversy over the Washington DC arts venue.

events.title: UN peacekeeping patrols suspended along Lebanon-Israel Blue Line

events.description: The reopening of the Rafah crossing in the southern Gaza Strip on Monday after more than a year is being met with both optimism and fear, a senior official with the UN agency that assists the Palestinian people, UNRWA, has said.

events.title: Invisible highways: The vast network of undersea cables powering our connectivity
events.description: Every day, we send countless emails, take part in video calls, use search engines and streaming services, while seamlessly banking online.

events.title: Savannah Guthrie's mother Nancy possibly abducted from her home, authorities say
events.description: Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother Nancy was possibly kidnapped from her Arizona home. The sheriff confirmed a crime scene was found, and believes she was taken against her will.

events.title: Virginia man Brendan Banfield learns fate in twisted au pair affair double-murder
events.description: Brendan Banfield, former IRS officer, was found guilty of orchestrating a murder plot with the family's au pair to kill his wife Christina and frame Joseph Ryan.

events.description: Bystander allegedly rams getaway car into Petaluma jewelry store during armed robbery, forcing suspects to flee on foot after dramatic intervention.

events.title: WATCH: Surgeon accused of killing ex-wife and her dentist husband appears unfazed during jail booking
events.description: Jail video shows surgeon accused of murdering ex-wife and her dentist husband calmly entering custody after extradition from Illinois to Ohio.

events.title: Minneapolis teachers union chief admits elected officials in anti-ICE Signal chats
events.description: Minneapolis teachers union head says elected officials join anti-ICE efforts, revealing coordination in Signal chats to protect neighbors from enforcement.

events.title: Groundhog Day: Punxsutawney Phil makes 140th weather prediction
events.description: Punxsutawney Phil emerges for the 140th annual Groundhog Day celebration as thousands gather to hear his winter prediction on Gobbler's Knob.

events.title: Hundreds of political prisoners in Venezuela could be released under new amnesty bill
events.description: Venezuela's acting president announces amnesty bill that could free hundreds of political prisoners, including opposition leaders and journalists.
